column2: BRIEF-Apache eyes more Eagle Ford activity at $65 a barrel-CEO * CEO says on track to achieve 25 percent reduction in average drilling and completion costs ~Apache has quarterly loss on lower oil prices May 7 Apache Corp on Thursday reported a quarterly loss compared with a year-earlier profit as significantly lower commodity prices prompted the U.S. oil and gas company to write down the value of some oil and gas properties. ~
UPDATE 1-Bank of America directors lose support from shareholders NEW YORK
column3: May 7 Four Bank of America Corp  directors on the board's governance committee received unusually small majorities of votes for re-election at this week's annual meeting
column4: according to tallies the company released on Thursday. ~

column2: Boeing
column3: CFM say LEAP-1B on track to hit 14 pct performance goal May 7 Boeing Co and CFM International said on Thursday that they had begun flight testing of the LEAP-1B engine for the 737 MAX jetliner
column4: and early tests show it was on track to deliver promised fuel savings
column5: knocking down talk about a significant performance shortfall. ~Airbus surges past Boeing in orders
